results.title: Pure steam: The Flying Scotsman in Australia (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Peter Henshaw, Jim Revitt and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: For almost a year the world’s most famous working steam locomotive, The Flying Scotsman 4472, from Britain, thrilled Australian steam enthusiasts from coast to coast. During 1988/89 4472 visited five Australian states and the Northern Territory. Its spectacular parallel runs, double-heading and solo trips have been brilliantly recorded by camera crews from ABC TV, from the air, trackside and on board.

results.title: Punk in London
results.brief_description: Originally shot in colour 16mm film, this DVD edition has some of the hallmarks of an old print - scratches, pink tinge in the colour and generally dubious quality. But all of this can be forgiven, as the content of the work is a wonderful documentary of live footage of concerts of UK punk bands given in late 1970s London and Germany. Features bands The Clash, The Adverts, The Jam, The Boomtown Rats, The Electric Chairs and others. Includes interviews, shots of street-wear fashion and crowds, including loving audiences pogo-ing with great delight and alcohol fuelled fervour. This film captures the youth of the day and their quest to make themselves seen and heard, singing “Oh Bondage, Up Yours!” Directed by Wolfgang Buld from the Munich Film School. (Please note a small glitch occurs at 00:09:57 min).

results.title: Public enemy no. 1
results.creator_credit: Fred S Nieman and National Women's Christian Temperance Union
results.brief_description: A moral guidance docudrama delivering a strong message about the evils of alcohol. A teenager fails a sobriety test after the police pull him over for erratic driving. He avoids arrest when the police decide to release him into the care of his physician father. Concerned by his son’s behaviour, the father organises a weekend in the country to impart his views about the dangers of alcohol. Throughout the weekend, dad discusses how alcoholic beverages are made, advertised and sold and their damaging effect on mind and body. Despite its intention, the film’s moral tone and wholesome setting would force most teenagers to resort to alcohol.

results.title: Project Vlad
results.creator_credit: Luke Dunn Gielmuda, Aaron Rogers and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Vlad is a Russian chimpanzee sent up to space as a cosmonaut in the middle of the Cold War. With the end of the stand off between the Soviet Union and the West, Vlad is trapped forever in an endless orbit, a victim of humanity and their history. This deceptively simple animation achingly conveys the alienation, terror and ultimate loneliness of the poor animal doomed to wander the cold metallic surfaces of his space pod. Visually and emotionally powerful.

results.title: Puberty blues [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Joan Long, Margaret Kelly and Limelight Productions
results.brief_description: Unusually, the focus here is on the sexual and social rites of passage of two teenage girls in a male-dominated world. Debbie and Sue are accepted into the Greenhills’ gang, an elite group occupying a particular stretch of Cronulla beach. As surfie groupies Debbie and Sue are required to submit to male whims. Although the girls are proposed as subjects the film maintains a humorously ironic distance from the awfulness of the scene, particularly through the use of narration. The boys, collectively dominant, are individually consigned to the margins. Debbie and Sue are the real mates who ultimately break out of the confines of male-imposed rules. Cast includes: Nell Schofield, Jad Capelja, Geoff Rhoe, Tony Hughes. Based on the book by Kathy Lette and Gabrielle Carey.

results.title: Priory, the only home I've got
results.creator_credit: Mark Dolgoy, Anne Wheeler, Michael Scott and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The Priory is a public extended care hospital in Victoria, B.C. for people suffering from chronic geriatric illnesses. Treatment is innovative. It is based on the theory that even the ordinary activities of a patient’s life contain elements of therapy. The film shows us how patients are encouraged to do as much as they can for themselves despite their confinement to wheelchairs. The hospital at the time of the film’s release, was considered to be a leader in the field of extended care. The film won awards in Toronto and New York.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mark Dolgoy, Anne Wheeler, Michael Scott and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Princess Mononoke [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Hayao Moyazaki, Toshio Suzuki, Dentsu, Nihon Terebi, Studio Ghibli Productions and Tokuma Shoten
results.brief_description: This ecologically-themed animated epic was the highest grossing film in Japanese film history at the time of its release. Set in the 14th century, a time when industry and firearms were introduced to feudal Japan, the story centres on Ashitka, a young warrior who, after being afflicted by a deadly curse whilst defending his village against an unknown demon, sets out to find a cure. On his journey he encounters industrialists who are damaging the nearby forest but creating employment, and forest dwellers and spirits who wish to protect their environment. Torn between his allegiances to each side, Ashitka must negotiate a middle-way between the two groups in order to avoid an all-out war. Refusing to reduce a complex problem to a simplistic opposition between good and evil, the film explores in depth the dilemma of balancing human needs with ecological preservation. Miyazaki is revered in Japan and overseas as one of the greatest artists of contemporary animation. Voices: Billy Crudup, Claire Danes, Minnie Driver, Billy Bob Thornton, Gillian Anderson, Jada Pinkett-Smith, John de Mita.

results.title: Psychoactive
results.creator_credit: William E. Cohen and Paul Steinbroner
results.brief_description: Surveys the effects of psychoactive drugs on the nine systems of the human body, and demonstrates how each system functions and how a drug intended for one body system throws the others into disequilibrium. Based on research and practical experience at the San Francisco Drug Detoxification and Rehabilitation Project.

results.title: Primary health care: a team approach
results.creator_credit: Ray Poole, Pierre Henfrey, Robert Kruger and NBC Films
results.brief_description: A film showing the health care provided in the Lisson Grove Health Centre, opened in 1978. Shows doctors, ward sisters, and district nurses at work and the value of having various health care workers under the same roof to make team work easier.

results.title: Psychling
results.brief_description: This film is an inspirational chronicle of one man’s determination to achieve a very specific goal: breaking the record for the fastest cross-country bicycle ride.
